_header: He that will not when he may / When he will he shall have nay
Note:
For similar lines in Fasciculus Morum see 6647; cf. also 1867; 2800, st. 39 (CUL only); bad key, 107 (4 lines); Furnivall (1867)
XFurnivall, Frederick James. The Boke of Norture, by John Russell, ab. 1460-70 A.D.
Roxburghe Club 87. Bungay: J. Childs and Son, 1867, 45. Further refs. in Meech (1940)
XMeech, Sanford Brown. “A Collection of Proverbs in Rawlinson MS D 328.” Modern Philology 38 (1940-41): 113-32, 126.
_description: A proverb — one couplet translating Qui non vult cum quit um vellet forte nequibit

BodDou52.Transcription: Who so wylle not when he mayHe shall not when he wylle
BodDou52.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Die Mittelenglische Sprichwörtersammlung in Douce 52.” 
             Festschrift zum XII Deutschen Neuphilolgentage in München
                1906.
            E. Stollreither, ed. 
         Erlangen (1906): 40-64: 57.

BodRawD328.Transcription: He þat wylnot whan he maya schall not whan he wyll
BodRawD328.Note:
Translating, ‘Qui non vult dum quid cum vellet forte
                        nequibit’, which precedes; English portion all written on one
                    line.
BodRawD328.Editions:
Meech,  Sanford Brown. 
             “A Collection of Proverbs in Rawlinson MS D 328.” 
             Modern Philology
         38 (1940-41): 113-32: 117.

CULEe437.Transcription:
He that will not when he mayWhen he will he shall naue
                    naye

DULCosViii9.Transcription:
he that wyll not whan he mayeWhan he wolde he shall haue
                    waye
DULCosViii9.Note: Added to left margin, bottom to top, immediately following 3010.
DULCosViii9.Facsimiles:
Burrow,  John,  and  A. I. Doyle, eds.  
             Thomas Hoccleve: A Facsimile of the Autograph Verse
                Manuscripts.
EETS
         s.s. 19 (2002).
DULCosViii9.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.   Hoccleve’s Works: The Minor Poems. vol. 1.  EETS
         e.s. 61 (1892); repr. with Gollancz (1925)
XGollancz,  Israel. 
             Hoccleve’s Works: The Minor Poems. vol. 2.  EETS
         e.s. 73 (1925); repr. with 61, 1970 73; rev. J.
            Mitchell and A. Ian Doyle, 1970: 28.

RylandsLat394.Transcription: Who so wol not whan he maye he shal not whan he wolde
RylandsLat394.Note: Written as one line; Latin follows.
RylandsLat394.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 108.

PierpontM124.Transcription:
He that will not when he mayeWhen he would he shall have
                    naye
PierpontM124.Note:
Added to lower margin by a hand of s. xvi, preceded by Latin text,
                        ‘Qui non vult dum quit cum vellet forte nequibit’, which
                    it translates.
PierpontM124.Editions:
Bergen,  Henry,
                        ed.  
             Lydgate’s Fall of Princes.
             4 vols. 
             EETS
         e.s. 121-24 (1924-27); repr. 1967: Part IV, p. 85.
